title: Stephen Colbert relives his Hobbit days and meets NZ PM Jacinda Ardern
text:
He made a cameo appearance in The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug in 2013.

And on Tuesday, Stephen Colbert paid homage to his character, the Laketown Spy, when he returned to New Zealand to film an episode of CBS's The Late Show.

Taking to Instagram, the 55-year-old comedian swapped his dapper, TV-ready appearance for a grubby hobbit costume.

Back to Middle Earth! On Tuesday, Stephen Colbert paid homage to his Hobbit character, the Laketown Spy, when he returned to New Zealand to film an episode of CBS's The Late Show

Just like his Hobbit character, Stephen wore an eyepatch and a hooded cape, which he paired with a long black wig.

In the photo, he posed against the backdrop of the picturesque Mount Cook National Park in Canterbury, on New Zealand's South Island.

He captioned the snap, 'Laketown Spy Returns!', and added the hashtag #LSSCinNZ.

Remember this? Stephen made a cameo appearance in 2013's The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug, which was filmed in New Zealand

Last Friday, the Emmy Award-winning television host shared a photo to Instagram of himself with New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern.

Stephen dressed appropriately for the occasion, wearing a grey suit, a white shirt and blue striped necktie.

'Me and the PM just chillin' in her backyard. Ya know, like ya do,' he captioned the snap, alongside the hashtag #NoSnakes.

Nice to meet you! Last Friday, the Emmy Award-winning television host shared a photo to Instagram of himself with New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern (right)

Last month, Jacinda appeared on The Late Show and joked that she would be happy to pick Stephen up at the airport when he arrived in New Zealand.

The Late Show isn't the first American talk show to film a special episode Down Under, as Conan O'Brien filmed segments in Sydney back in February.

Last week, Channel 10 announced that James Corden will be filming several episodes of The Late Late Show in Australia in 2021.
